data.title: shrimp appetizer
data.text: In a hotel near downtown - try the shrimp appetizer.  Unusually good.  Mostly average food overall but tries to be gourmet.

data.title: Worst experience in dining ever!
data.text: Worst experience I have ever had in a restaurant.  We had an 11 AM reservation on Sunday for brunch.  We were told we had to order lunch.  Breakfast was posted as being served until 12 noon so I questioned this.  We were then given breakfast menus.  When we tried to give our order the waitress excused herself and when she returned she informed us that we could not order off the menu but could get the breakfast buffet or lunch. The reason we were given was that they were too busy.  Aside from a large party that was leaving and one other party in the restaurant we were the only diners. We reluctantly agreed to the buffet.  The omelet station took so long that I ended up giving up and eating scrambled eggs.  The waitress was rude, staff poorly trained.  I was taking family to brunch and was embarrassed. Never again.

data.title: So Disappointing
data.text: The menu is very promising. We had a carnivore and several vegetarians who eat fish and a vegan in our group so we were excited to see options for everyone. Unfortunately, other than the meat-eater, we were all disappointed. Food was dry, unimpressive.  Maybe it was just an off-night.

data.title: This is a review of the Grill restaurant
data.text: Interesting offerings, wish I could have tried more.  They accommodated our desire for a half-and half pizza.  The bread that comes with the meal is pretzel bread (Duh!).  Attentive service. Went here only for the convenience while staying at the hotel.

data.title: Don't waste your time
data.text: While the food was very good.....interesting flavorful combos.  It wasn't worth the 90 min plus wait at an off time.  The restaurant wasn't busy only 3 tables of no more than 4 at each most with two.  The wait staff is rude. Very slow and unorganized. Much better fine dinning choices in the area

data.title: Great Hotel Lounge
data.text: Great location to have a drink and to people watch. Lancaster is a great city and this is a fun place to stop in for a drink and dinner!

data.title: There Should be Better Choices...
data.text:
We are locals and have been to the Penn Square Grille on numerous occasions. It has never been great...but for an early Sunday morning brunch, there are not many choices nearby. Today, however, the experience sunk to a new low.

We entered and waited behind another party to be seated. No one came for some time. Finally a server came over and told us someone would soon be over. No one came over. The server finally came over and began to seat us when the proper person arrived...and complained to the server about what gave her the right to seat people. 

Our drink orders were taken rapidly and the drinks arrived fairly quickly, we did have to request one item several times before it finally came much later (and it was only water with lemon...and the lemon ended up being a bit...er...spoiled).

We got the buffet, and waited in a short but long line for omelets. The omelet chef is not ever particularly friendly...today was no exception. In fact, as the person went flipped an omelet and missed a bit, they let loose with some foul language. They ended up being down to one burner, which slowed things farther. By the time my burned omelet was done (burned enough that the omelet person actually took off a piece and threw it out), and I returned to our table, others were just about finished with their breakfast. The omelet person also makes Belgian waffles...however, when getting them out of the waffle maker, he did not use tongs...but picked them up with his hands..which were gloved, but still...

My son, who decided not to wait in the long line had gone to the remainder of the buffet. He had gotten a danish, only to find a hair in it.

I tried the remainder of the buffet...they were out of scrambled eggs. I got the last few potatoes. Others were looking for basics like butter and couldn't find it.

The staff is never particularly friendly, and this was true again today.

Given the ridiculously high price for the buffet, we had about enough. We brought this all to the attention of a manager, who personally apologized to us twice, and who was kind enough to adjust our bill as a recompense. We do very much appreciate his actions, and had it not been for this, the rating would have been lower.

Still, we have given this place several chances, and this was the end of the line. Next time when we in town this early, before places like Annie Bailey's are open for Sunday brunch, we will simply drive to some other part of town for brunch rather than come back here.

If you are visiting the hotel...try the brunch..try someplace like Annie Bailey's or "On Orange" or someplace else. Don't waste your time and money here.

data.title: Good for Weary Travelers
data.text: As indicated in our review of the Lancaster Marriott, the restaurant always had a good 'buzz' about it of folks enjoying themselves.  Never too busy, but never empty either.  Food was ok, passable, not extraordinary.  If you're weary and don't feel like walking down the block and taking advantage of Lancaster's great restaurant scene, then by all means, Penn Square Grill and Rendevous Lounge are absolutely fine.

data.title: Unique lounge food
data.text: We went there for the experience and had a good visit. We ate in the lounge because the restaurant was too busy at 7:00. The menu had no prices. The food was good with being served a pretzel bread loaded with philly cheese steak. It had a unique twist of a sandwich. We could choose what went with it. My husband had French fries and I had ceaser salad. The down side was the tables and chairs were all high. Maybe senior citizens don't go there!

data.title: PSG&R Lounge's Bar Menu Is Better Than Most
data.text: What a long name for a nice hotel restaurant in Lancaster's Penn Square!  I try to avoid hotel restaurants when I'm traveling because I prefer to enjoy local eateries.  After an enjoyable, but long, hot day at a local amusement park with children and grandchildren -- checking in at the hotel and sliding right into the lounge fit the bill.  The dinner menu is offered along with the bar menu, so you have a wide selection to choose from -- even if you're just in the lounge.  Good food, good service -- a bit pricey, but not unusual for a hotel menu.  Highly recommend!

data.title: Like it at the marriott
data.text: So kid friendly, nice ambiance, comfy chairs, good kids menu, good service, love the marriott, delicious bouillabaisse

data.title: Wonderful Brunch in the Gorgeous Penn Sq. Grille Dining Room
data.text: What a great place. Right off the city square in Lancaster, and very close to the Lancaster City Central Market, a great place for a full, filling rustic brunch, lunch or dinner.

data.title: had dinner here and it was to die for!!
data.text: my friend surprised his parents for dinner and it went off without a hitch! the staff helped coordinate the dinner by keeping my friends arrival a secret! his mom was more than surprised to see him come around the corner of the bar! she did a double take a slightly screamed out of her seat! it was a great night; from the surprise entrance, to the drinks and food for dinner, to the attention from the waiter... dinner was amazing! steak was tender, beet salad and scallops (which i had was amazing!) the NY sirloin (i think) with fries was also very well done. there were so many desserts to choose from but all of them were delicious!

data.title: Satisfying lunch in a quiet setting
data.text: We decided to have lunch both days at the Grille and had satisfying meals and great experiences both days.

data.title: Great Food in a Beautiful Setting
data.text: Enjoyed a special meal with our adult children at the Grille.  Very beautiful setting in the downtown center of Lancaster.  The chic decor sets a great stage for even more chic food!  Loved the menu, was full of creative dishes and was not the standard restaurant fare.  Enjoy, one of our favorites

data.title: Convenient to the convention center.
data.text: Dropped in at the last minute from the convention for lunch It is tucked away past the bar which probably made it slower to fill. The food was quite good. and the staff helpful  and always buzzing around to see if everything was OK. Our tea and coffee were included in the price of the entree ( on the menu it says soda included but we didn't ask and the coffee and tea were not charged.  The salmon on the salad was done  quite nicely and it was a large piece. I wouldn't consider it a destination restaurant but a solid choice if you're at the convention center as it is in the Marriott attached to the convention center.

data.title: Eastern States Wine Conference
data.text: We enjoyed Happy Hours in the Rendezvous bar. Restaurant had a wide variety of cuisine and a fine selection of wines. Cheers...

data.title: Christmas vacation
data.text:
While celebrating Christmas in Lancaster, PA, my wife and I spent the week at the Lancaster Marriott on Penn Square. We ate most of our meals at the Penn Square Grille in the hotel and were pleased with the selection and quality.  All of our breakfasts were at the grille, as were three dinners, including Christmas day.  Breakfast was the fine Marriott buffet we've gotten to know and love, as we are regular Marriott customers.  Included was a new twist on breakfast home fries which we quite enjoyed, and the made to order omlets were perfect!  Turkey dinner on Christmas day was extra special with the wait staff seeing to our every need in holiday fashion. 

Other dinners we enjoyed at the grille included an excellent burger (the Penn Square Grille Burger), the speck wrapped pork tenderloin, and the short ribs with butternut squash ravioli.  It's worth noting that the roasted garlic and white bean soup is to die for!

For most of our meals, our servers, Prastut and Abby, and Camille our hostess, provided exceptional service.  When in Lancaster, don't miss the Penn Square Grille at the Marriott!

data.title: Nice Interior, Food OK, won't go again
data.text: Nice interior, good location. Had business dinner party, place was not busy. Good menus is odd, especially dessert, no good base choice. Evidently there is a desert of the day of which we learned by accident - took the cheesecake which was harder then bread, dried up. The steak was mostly likely done in a oven, no smoke flavor. The place needs a new chef with a flare.

data.title: Breakfast buffet not up to par with other Marriott restaurants
data.text:
My wife and I had the breakfast buffet here for two mornings while staying at the adjacent Marriott.   The price of the buffet was $14.95 including juice and coffee.  We ate here the second day mainly for the convenience of our baby and my wife's conference, not for the food.   The buffet was not up to par with most other breakfast buffets that I have enjoyed at Marriott hotel restaurants.   For example the muffins were obviously made from a mix with dried or imitation bluberries, the cleanliness was questionable, the sausage looked like swift premium rather than the nice plump links, the fruit looked like it had been around, the home fries had little taste and never did I get a good morning or any sense of caring or professionalism from the omelette maker.  Also, some of his actions should not have been done in front of the guest like tearing open a plastic bag of goat cheese and squeezing it onto your omelette or grabbing the wafflle with his hand rather than using tongs.   I got the feeling there was no mgmt supervision of the buffet.  
Aside from the food the servers were very friendly and accomodating to us and our baby which we appreciated and the atmosphere in the restaurant is pleasant and relaxed.  
If you are not going to do a buffet right don't do it at all.
